Preface
About this Book
This book is about the Cisco Unified Application Environment (CUAE) and how to use it to build applications that leverage the Cisco Unified Communications System platform. Cisco's Unified Communications System platform is deployed in over 40,000 businesses and is the market leading voice, video, and data communications platform available on the market today. This book will teach you how to create software applications for the communications market and how to enhance existing software by embedding communications capabilities. The material in this book will cover, from the ground up, the CUAE language, how to apply it to practical problems, how to extend it by building plug-ins, and how to integrate it with other popular programming languages and frameworks.
Why Read this Book?

Using this Book
This book is intended to give novice and expert software developers an understanding of all tools and techniques required to be successful developing applications using the Cisco Unified Applications Environment. It is split into four main parts. The first part, CUAE Programming Fundamentals, is intended to be read first and completed sequentially. The remaining three parts of the book can be tackled piecemeal and in whichever order the reader finds most suitable for their experience level and goals.
CUAE Programming Fundamentals
This part introduces the CUAE Software Development Kit (SDK), core language concepts, a detailed explanation of the CUAE application execution model, debugging strategies, and other tools and techniques that can be used when building applications using the CUAE. Additionally, a thorough explanation of the Cisco Unified Visual Designer and how to use its graphical programming model is presented.
Practical Application of the CUAE
This portion of the book explores how to apply the CUAE and its capabilities to various areas of unified communications. Covered in detail are how to build call control applications, how to leverage the media processing capabilities of the system, consuming web services, leveraging the HTTP capabilities of CUAE, building IP phone services, leveraging the AVVID XML Layer (AXL-SOAP) for programmatic configuration of CUCM, and much more.
Building Plug-ins to Extend the CUAE
The CUAE is built around a very robust extensibility model. Multiple plug-in layers enable developers to extend the capabilities of the Application Server and leverage those extensions within the Visual Designer. Chapters within this portion of the book explore how to build each of the differing types of plug-ins, installing those plug-ins, and using them from within the Visual Designer.
Integrating CUAE Applications with Friends
Often times CUAE applications must interact with services or applications built in other languages and runtime environments such as J2EE and web services. This part of the book describes effective strategies for integrating with other applications built using other technologies.
Appendices are provided that cover various primer material for developers who do not have exposure to telephony or other tangential technologies that the CUAE leverages extensively. It is recommended that you read those applicable appendices before progressing through the book if you are not familiar with the relevant foundation material. Finally, all examples in this book (including this book itself) are included as part of the CUAE SDK package to make it easier for you to load, build, and run examples as you encounter them.
